title: Balakot Hero Abhinandan Varthaman Enthralls Audience On 87th Air Force Day At Hindon Air Base
text:
On this 87th Air Force Day, Wing Commander Abhinandan Varthaman flew a MiG-21 at an air show that was held at the Hindon Air Base in Ghaziabad during the celebrations of the day on Tuesday.

The air show also had aerial displays of fighter aircraft by other Balakot heroes too. Abhinandan led a group of three MiG-21s flying in avenger formation and the other Balakot heroes Group Captains Saumitra Tamaskar and Hemant Kumar flew a Jaguar and Mirage 2000, respectively.

#WATCH Ghaziabad: Wing Commander #AbhinandanVarthaman leads a 'MiG formation' and flies a MiG Bison Aircraft at Hindon Air Base on #AirForceDay today. pic.twitter.com/bRpgW7MUxu — ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) October 8, 2019

Army Chief General Bipin Rawat and IAF Chief, Air Chief Marshal Rakesh Kumar Singh Bhaduria were also present at the event.

Huge cheers from the crowd were heard when Abhinandan’s aerial maneuver on the MiG-21 were displayed. The 87th Air Force Day was also marked by aerial displays of newly inducted attack chopper Apache and the twin-rotor blade Chinook chopper besides other aircraft.

Ghaziabad: Aircraft of Indian Air Force fly at Hindon Air Base during the event on #AirForceDay today. Wing Commander #AbhinandanVarthaman flew a MiG Bison Aircraft, 3 Mirage 2000 aircraft & 2 Su-30MKI fighter aircraft were also flown by pilots who took part in Balakot air strike pic.twitter.com/nlEqavrj3w — ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) October 8, 2019

On March 1, Wing Commander Abhinandan Varthaman returned to India after Pakistan released after extreme diplomatic pressure. The whole country was teary-eyed after his return and he became the nation's hero. The only man to ever shoot down a F-16 fighter.

He was also bestowed with the country's top military honour, Vir Chakra, on Independence Day (August 15) for his tremendous courage and valour. Now, he is back in action or rather we'll say back in his cockpit and started flying MiG-21 jet again. Vir Chakra is the third highest gallantry award after the Paramvir Chakra and the Mahavir Chakra.
